## The following workbooks are due the Friday after lecture. You will be marked on 10 submissions

## Week 1: Due FRIDAY 27th February

  1.  Set up a github account. Choose a username that will be OK for professional purposes.

  2.  Create your first repository
  
  3.  Create a GitHub project in Rstudio for this repository

  4.  Commit your first  Rmarkdown journal
  - Create your first Rmarkdown document, and title it "My Journal" 
  - Record your impressions of the process of getting set up with RStudio and GitHub
  - Record any help you have offered to other people, and any help you have sought from other people, along the way. 
  - Save the document and commit it to GitHub. 

  5.  Email a link to your repository to: 
  johannes.karl@vuw.ac.nz 
  cc: joseph.bulbulia@vuw.ac.nz 
  
This journal will count as both your weekly journal entry and your weekly workbook.
